name: Olympus Mons
description: The largest volcano in the Solar System, rising over 21 kilometers above the Martian surface

steps.title: Approach the base
steps.description: Navigate rover to the volcano's outer rim through the steep basal scarp
steps.details: The basal scarp rises up to 6 km above surrounding plains, forming a massive cliff

steps.title: Collect rock samples
steps.description: Extract volcanic rock from the caldera complex
steps.details: The caldera contains overlapping collapse craters formed by magma withdrawal

steps.title: Analyze data
steps.description: Process samples and send results to Earth
steps.details: Samples contain basaltic lava with iron oxides, silicates, and traces of halloysite clay

scientific_significance: Reveals Mars' volcanic history and tectonic evolution

name: Valles Marineris
description: The largest canyon system in the Solar System, stretching over 3,000 kilometers
location: Near Martian equator, extending from Noctis Labyrinthus to chaotic terrain

facts.comparison: More than 10 times longer and 6 times deeper than Earth's Grand Canyon
facts.formation: Tectonic fracture from Tharsis uplift, widened by erosion

steps.title: Survey from above
steps.description: Map the canyon using aerial drone
steps.details: Use MOLA laser altimeter data to create precise topographic maps

steps.title: Descend into canyon
steps.description: Carefully navigate down the steep walls
steps.details: Walls expose layered deposits of carbonates and sulfates from ancient water

steps.title: Study rock layers
steps.description: Examine geological history in exposed walls
steps.details: Layers reveal billions of years of Mars' geological evolution and climate history

scientific_significance: Clues to Mars' tectonic evolution, climate history, and potential past habitability

name: Mars Polar Ice Caps
description: Dynamic regions of carbon dioxide and water ice revealing Mars' climate history

facts.composition: CO₂ dry ice dominates; water ice persists year-round
facts.seasonal_changes: CO₂ sublimates in spring, refreezes in winter

steps.title: Prepare for extreme cold
steps.details: Atmospheric pressure drops to only 72 pascals at the summit

steps.title: Drill ice core
steps.description: Extract deep ice sample for climate data
steps.details: Use SHARAD radar to map subsurface ice layers and dust deposits

steps.title: Analyze ice composition
steps.description: Study water and CO₂ layers in sample
steps.details: Layers preserve records of atmospheric variation and axial tilt changes

scientific_significance: Reveals climate cycles, atmospheric processes, and possible water resources

name: Cheyava Falls
description: Potential biosignature discovery in Jezero Crater showing complex organic-mineral interactions
location: Bright Angel Formation, northern rim of Neretva Vallis, Jezero Crater

facts.elements: Organic carbon, iron, sulfur, phosphorus, hydrogen

steps.title: Approach the formation
steps.description: Navigate to Bright Angel Formation in Jezero Crater
steps.details: Ancient delta where rivers once fed a lake billions of years ago

steps.title: Analyze rock patterns
steps.description: Use SHERLOC and PIXL to study reaction fronts
steps.details: Detect organic carbon with phosphorus and sulfur in millimeter-scale textures

steps.title: Collect sample
steps.description: Extract Sapphire Canyon sample for Earth return
steps.details: Sealed sample tube for future Mars Sample Return mission analysis

scientific_significance: First detection of simultaneous organic compounds, phosphorus, and redox-sensitive minerals in lacustrine context

name: Mars: The Red Planet
description: Comprehensive overview of Mars' characteristics, climate, and exploration history

steps.title: Understand basic characteristics
steps.description: Learn about Mars' size, composition, and orbital properties
steps.details: Mars is about half the size of Earth with similar day length but much longer year

steps.title: Explore surface features
steps.description: Study major geological formations and surface composition
steps.details: Dominant features include Olympus Mons, Valles Marineris, and Tharsis region

steps.title: Investigate potential for life
steps.description: Examine evidence of past water and current exploration
steps.details: Evidence suggests Mars was habitable 3-4 billion years ago with flowing water

scientific_significance: Template for planetary evolution and potential future human exploration
